title: Missed opportunities doom Knights
text:
Jesus Jimenez , jjimenez@richmond.gannett.com 12:59 a.m. EDT October 24, 2015 Northeastern High School football Alec Hughes (Photo: Palladium-Item Joshua Smith) 7 CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
CHARLOTTESVILLE, Ind. -- Ask Mike Roeder to describe his Northeastern High School football team’s 2015 season, and the word that comes to mind is heart. 
Questions before the season were all about replacing the scoring. 
After week 1, there were questions about replacing injuries. 
Those never stopped, and despite getting players back, there was always more adversity. 
Entering Friday night’s IHSAA Class 2A Sectional 38 opener at Eastern Hancock, Roeder and the Knights knew they were faced with a tough task. 
Yet, they weren’t backing down. 
A few missed opportunities in the first half were the difference, and Eastern Hancock took over. 
A two-touchdown lead quickly doubled in the third quarter and the Royals ran away with a 35-0 victory over the Knights Friday night. 
“The season was a tremendous success,” Roeder said of his Knights, who finished 7-3 and won a third straight Tri-Eastern Conference title. “We had some great moments, who will ever forget winning at Union County like we did (recovering a fumble in the end zone for a game-winning touchdown), and then we finished the season with a couple shutouts and the big win versus Winchester – those are some great memories, and I’ll say that again. This team, when we think of them, we’ll think of the word heart.” 
The Knights had an opportunity to score on their first drive but had a ball dropped that could have led to a score. 
They had first-and-goal from the Eastern Hancock 4-yard line, but were stopped, thanks in big part to a fumble that led to an eight-yard loss. 
The Royals took advantage and took a 14-0 lead into halftime – a 55-yard touchdown run by Matt Bowman, and a 3-yard score by Bowman with about 43 seconds left. 
That doubled when Devin Denny scored just 20 seconds into halftime on a 62-yard run, and added a 50-yard score about two minutes later. 
Denny added a 17-yard pass from Jarrett Lewis later in the quarter for the final score. 
“They have some good players,” said Eastern Hancock coach Jim O’Hara, whose team improved to 10-0 and advances to face Indianapolis Howe in next week’s sectional semifinal. “They have some good size and our defense, we’re not real big. We have to rely on fundamentals and keeping low and our quickness. Northeastern gave us everything we wanted and the thing that turned was that goal-line stand when it was first-and-goal on the 5, we held them and then our offense took off, so we’re proud of our kids and our coaching staff.” 
Indianapolis Howe defeated Milan 57-35. Centerville defeated Switzerland County 21-0 and will face Triton Central, who defeated Union County 45-6. 
Cole Retter had 21 carries for 76 yards to lead Northeastern, while Jacob Auger had 12 for 73, along with four completions for 8 yards. Connor Bray had five rushes for 18 yards and Alec Hughes added four rushes for six yards and had an interception on defense. 
Northeastern is only the third team to win three straight TEC titles. 
ROYALS 35, 
Northeastern 0 0 0 0 -- 0 
Eastern Hancock 0 14 21 0 -- 35 
Second Quarter 
EH- Matt Bowman 55 run, 6:46 (2-point pass) 
EH- Bowman 3 run, :42.3 (kick failed) 
Third Quarter 
EH- Devin Denny 62 run, 11:40 (A. J. Muegge kick) 
EH- Denny 50 run, 9:25 (Muegge kick)
